intro: Pimpinella macrophylla, commonly known as large-leaf cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its tall, branched stems and compound leaves that are broad and deeply lobed. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the carrot family (Apiaceae). Its foliage has a mild, aromatic scent, and it thrives in well-drained soils in full sun to partial shade. Pimpinella macrophylla is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats and is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens.
